CatDescriptText: Mozella Daniels, housewife, 2425 Chauncey Drive, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 15, 1959, pg. B1 with question: "Do you believe judges give society proper protection by refusing to send confessed murderers, guilty of murder in the first degree, to the electric chair?" answer reads: "No, they are not giving us protection when they do this. And the reason is that if the man is allowed to go loose to receive parole, he may do worse to us than he did the other time."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Mozella Daniels wearing light colored short sleeved floral dress and eyeglasses, holding donation cup inscribed "God in Christ...street" standing on sidewalk in front block building, Downtown
